alert.note: Alert for Blair; Cambria; Centre; Clearfield; Somerset (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 7:44AM EST until January 14 at 9:00AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: The National Weather Service in State College PA has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Central Blair County in central Pennsylvania... Cambria County in central Pennsylvania... Southwestern Centre County in central Pennsylvania... South central Clearfield County in central Pennsylvania... Somerset County in south central Pennsylvania... * Until 900 AM EST. * At 742 AM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Hastings to near Blairsville to Lawson Heights to Fairdale, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following Interstates... The Pennsylvania Turnpike from mile markers 101 to 121. Interstate 99 from mile markers 25 to 68. This snow squall will be near... Nanty-Glo, Prince Gallitzin State Park, and Belsano around 750 AM EST. Westmont, Johnstown, and Ebensburg around 800 AM EST. Belmont, Loretto, and Dale around 810 AM EST. Tyrone, Portage, and Altoona around 820 AM EST. Windber, Scalp Level, and Birmingham around 830 AM EST. Other locations impacted by this snow squall include Tunnelhill, Ramey, Spring Hill, Mundys Corner, and Cassandra. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
